alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 6:43PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Moore and Lincoln Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 643 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Ardmore, or 11 miles east of Pulaski, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Lincoln, Mulberry, Howell, Belleville, Dellrose, Belleview, Mimosa and Booneville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
